COVID-19 - School Updates and News
April 20, 2020
Hello Liberty Parents,
Great News! Beginning this Friday, April 24, our Friday pick-up meals will also include breakfast and lunch for Saturday and Sunday for students and siblings, ages 1-18! So, for example, if youre picking up meals for three children on Friday, you also will receive breakfast and lunch for each of them for Saturday and Sunday.
Directions for reheating will be included in the weekend meals as hot meals will be on the menu those days as well. Lunch entrees will come with a milk and either a fruit, veggie, chips or cookies. Breakfast comes with a box of cereal or a cereal bar, fruit and milk.
Remember, the meals are free for all students and siblings, ages 1-18. Meals can be picked up Monday-Friday from 10:30 am to Noon while supplies last. Children do NOT need to be with you in order to receive their meals. If youre unable to pick up the meals, your students can pick them up if they can safely walk, or ride their bikes, scooters or skateboards to school, and you have given them permission to do so.
Were thankful to our caf manager and staff for extending the free meals to the weekend. This is an additional offering theyre thrilled to provide as weve heard over and over again what a great help these meals are to so many of our families.
We look forward to continuing to see you and your students at meal pick-up time!
Take care,
Mrs. Rebecca Stallcop
Administrator
Liberty Charter School District #458
************************************************************************************
20 de abril de 2020
Hola padres
Una gran noticia! A partir de este viernes 24 de abril, nuestras comidas de recogida del viernes tambin incluirn desayuno y almuerzo los sbados y domingos para estudiantes y hermanos de 1 a 18 aos! Entonces, por ejemplo, si est recogiendo comidas para tres nios el viernes, tambin recibir desayuno y almuerzo para cada uno de ellos el sbado y el domingo.
Las instrucciones para el recalentamiento se incluirn en las comidas de fin de semana, ya que las comidas calientes tambin estarn en el men esos das. Las entradas para el almuerzo vendrn con leche y frutas, verduras, papas fritas o galletas. El desayuno viene con una caja de cereal o una barra de cereal, fruta y leche.
Recuerde, las comidas son gratuitas para todos los estudiantes y hermanos, de 1 a 18 aos. Las comidas se pueden recoger de lunes a viernes de 10:30 a.m. a medioda hasta agotar existencias. Los nios NO necesitan estar con usted para recibir sus comidas. Si no puede recoger las comidas, sus estudiantes pueden recogerlas si pueden caminar con seguridad o andar en bicicleta, patinetas o patinetas a la escuela, y usted les ha dado permiso para hacerlo.
Agradecemos al gerente y al personal de nuestro caf por extender las comidas gratis hasta el fin de semana. Esta es una oferta adicional que estn encantados de ofrecer, ya que hemos escuchado una y otra vez la gran ayuda que estas comidas son para muchas de nuestras familias.
Esperamos seguir vindote a ti y a tus estudiantes a la hora de recoger la comida!
Cudate,
Sra. Rebecca Stallcop
Administrador
Liberty Charter School # 458
April 17, 2020
Hello Parents of K-8 Students
As we end this first week of remote learning and move into the next, I want to thank you I couldnt be prouder of the partnership between our teachers and parents! What is occurring to help keep Harbor learning happening remotely is amazing. Everyones efforts are appreciated.
Here are a few reminders as we go into week two:
nWe have carefully sterilized the school and packed up students desks, placing their personal items in individual bags, along with other items they will need going forward. (School employees have worn masks and gloves, and followed other health protocols in order to do this work safely.)Beginning Monday, April 20, from 8 a.m. to Noon,parents may pick up their students bagsby driving up to the front of the school where an employee runner will retrieve them from inside the school building and bring to your car.Thank you for following these strict guidelines ofno entry into the school. Our purpose in doing so is to ensure everyones health and safety while keeping the school clean and sanitized.
nIf your childs teacher has communicated with you that he or she will have learning packets to pick up at the school,those packets will continue to be distributed outside of the school building with the help of a school aide.Therefore, you will not enter the school building to receive your childs packet.
nThe free meal pick up for students and siblings, ages 1-18, has been great! Keep coming by to pick up their breakfasts & lunches and to say hi. We appreciate being able to stay connected in this way with parents and students. The pick-up time for meals is 10:30 am to Noon, Monday-Friday. Again,please stay in your car (and please have children remain in your car as well). We will bring the meals to you.Students and siblings do not have to be with you in order to pick up their meals. The meals are to be taken and not consumed on site. If students have your permission, they can walk, or ride their bikes, scooters, or skateboards to school to pick up meals.
We wish more than anything that the school was full of students and teachers going about their normal routine. But until that time returns, we will embrace this altered learning approach and make it the best it can be for students.
Thank you, and continue to stay safe and well.
Mrs. Rebecca Stallcop
Administrator
Liberty Charter School District #458
**********************************************************************************
17 de abril de 2020
Hola padres de estudiantes de K-8 -
Al finalizar esta primera semana de aprendizaje remoto y pasar a la siguiente, quiero agradecerles: no podra estar ms orgulloso de la asociacin entre nuestros maestros y padres! Lo que est ocurriendo para ayudar a mantener el aprendizaje de Harbor sucediendo de forma remota es increble. Los esfuerzos de todos son apreciados.
Aqu hay algunos recordatorios a medida que avanzamos en la segunda semana:
nHemos esterilizado cuidadosamente la escuela y empacado los escritorios de los estudiantes, colocando sus artculos personales en bolsas individuales, junto con otros artculos que necesitarn en el futuro. (Los empleados de la escuela usaron mscaras y guantes, y siguieron otros protocolos de salud para hacer este trabajo de manera segura.)A partir del lunes 20 de abril, de 8 am a medioda, los padres pueden recoger las maletas de sus estudiantes conduciendo hasta el frente de la escuela donde un corredor empleado los recuperar del interior del edificio escolar y los llevar a su automvil. Gracias por seguir estas estrictas pautas de no ingresar a la escuela.Nuestro propsito al hacerlo es garantizar la salud y la seguridad de todos al tiempo que mantenemos la escuela limpia y desinfectada.
nSi el maestro de su hijo se ha comunicado con usted que tendr paquetes de aprendizaje para recoger en la escuela,esos paquetes continuarn siendo distribuidos fuera del edificio escolar con la ayuda de un ayudante escolar.Por lo tanto, no ingresar al edificio de la escuela para recibir el paquete de su hijo.
nLa comida gratis recogida para estudiantes y hermanos, de 1 a 18 aos, ha sido genial! Sigue viniendo para recoger sus desayunos y almuerzos y para decir hola. Apreciamos poder estar conectados de esta manera con padres y estudiantes. El horario de recogida para las comidas es de 10:30 a.m. a medioda, de lunes a viernes.Nuevamente, qudese en su automvil (y haga que los nios tambin permanezcan en su automvil). Le traeremos las comidas.Los estudiantes y hermanos no tienen que estar con usted para recoger sus comidas. Las comidas deben tomarse y no consumirse en el sitio. Si los estudiantes tienen su permiso, pueden caminar o andar en bicicleta, patineta o patineta a la escuela para recoger las comidas.
Deseamos ms que nada que la escuela estuviera llena de estudiantes y maestros que siguieran con su rutina normal. Pero hasta que regrese ese tiempo, adoptaremos este enfoque de aprendizaje alterado y lo haremos lo mejor posible para los estudiantes.
Gracias, y contine mantenindose seguro y bien.
Sra. Rebecca Stallcop
Administrador
Liberty Charter School District # 458
April 13, 2020
Hello Parents!
We had a great, first day providing the breakfast & lunch combo meals for pick-up at the school! Thanks to everyone who came. Were looking forward to continuing this service and seeing even more of you take part!
Remember, your student(s) and siblings, ages 1-18, do NOT need to be with you to receive their meals and the meals areFREEfor every child. If youre unable to pick up meals, but your students are able to walk or ride their bikes to school (and you have given them permission to do so), they can pick up them up. The meals can be picked up Monday-Friday from 10:30 am to Noon.
And these lunches arent peanut butter and jelly sandwiches! Rather, theyre exactly what would be served if it were lunch time in the school building. Therefore, heres the upcoming menu:
4/14...Chicken nuggets
4/15...Corn dogs
4/16...Rippers
4/17...Nachos
4/20...Personal pan pizza
4/21...tangerine chicken rice bowl
4/22...Chicken Burger
4/23...Crispitos
4/24...Hamburgers and fries
4/27...Rippers
4/28...Popcorn chicken
4/29...Hamburger and fries
4/30...Nachos
5/1.....French toast sticks and sausage
5/4.....Chicken Tenders
5/5.....Build a sandwich
5/6.....Chicken nuggets
5/7.....Chicken fried steak (potatoes and gravy)
5/8.....Chefs choice
All lunch entrees come with a milk and either a fruit, veggie, chips or cookies. Breakfast comes with a box of cereal or a cereal bar, fruit and milk.
Thank you for your support as we get this meal combo pick-up program underway. If your students would like to make signs to hang out your car windows saying hi to their teachers, EAs, principal, or friends, have them bring those along and well do our best to take pictures & videos to post on the schools website and social media!
We look forward to seeing you tomorrow and in the days ahead!
13 de abril de 2020
Hola padres
Tuvimos un gran primer da brindando las comidas combinadas de desayuno y almuerzo para recoger en la escuela! Gracias a todos los que vinieron. Esperamos continuar este servicio y ver a ms de ustedes participar!
Recuerde, su (s) estudiante (s) y hermanos, de 1 a 18 aos de edad, NO necesitan estar con usted para recibir sus comidas y las comidas son GRATUITAS para cada nio. Si no puede recoger las comidas, pero sus estudiantes pueden caminar o andar en bicicleta a la escuela (y usted les ha dado permiso para hacerlo), pueden recogerlas. Las comidas se pueden recoger de lunes a viernes de 10:30 a.m. a medioda.
Y estos almuerzos no son sndwiches de mantequilla de man y mermelada! Ms bien, son exactamente lo que se servira si fuera la hora del almuerzo en el edificio de la escuela. Por lo tanto, aqu est el prximo men:
4/14 ... Nuggets de pollo
4/15 ... Perros de maz
4/16 ... Desgarradores
4/17 ... Nachos
4/20 ... Pan personal pizza
4/21 ... tazn de arroz con pollo y mandarina
4/22 ... hamburguesa de pollo
4/23 ... Crispitos
4/24 ... Hamburguesas y papas fritas
4/27 ... Desgarradores
4/28 ... pollo con palomitas de maz
4/29 ... hamburguesas y papas fritas
4/30 ... Nachos
5/1 ..... palitos de pan tostado francs y salchichas
5/4 ..... Licitaciones de pollo
5/5 ..... Construye un sndwich
5/6 ..... Nuggets de pollo
5/7 ..... Filete de pollo frito (papas y salsa)
5/8 ..... Eleccin del chef
Todos los platos principales del almuerzo vienen con leche y frutas, verduras, papas fritas o galletas. El desayuno viene con una caja de cereal o una barra de cereal, fruta y leche.
Gracias por su apoyo mientras ponemos en marcha este programa combinado de comidas. Si a sus estudiantes les gustara hacer letreros para colgar las ventanas de su automvil y saludar a sus maestros, EA, director o amigos, pdales que los traigan y haremos todo lo posible para tomar fotos y videos para publicar en la escuela. sitio web y redes sociales!
Esperamos verte maana y en los prximos das!
April 12, 2020
Hello Parents of Our K-8 Students
As we begin this first week in our distance learning format, there are a few items in which we need to be mindful to ensure the health and safety of our school community:
n If your childs teacher has communicated with you that he or she will have learning packets for you to pick up at the school, please note that the packets will be distributed to you outside of the school building with the help of a school aide. Therefore, you will not enter the school building to receive your childs packet.
n The same will occur for picking up student and sibling free breakfast and lunch combo, take-with-you meals. The pick-up time for the meals is 10:30 am to Noon, Monday-Friday. Please stay in your car (and please ensure any children with you remain in your car as well). When you are greeted by a school employee or principal, let them know the number of meals you need for your student(s) and siblings, ages 1-18, and he or she will retrieve them for you. (There might be a line, so please be patient with the school employee as he or she works to take care of each and every one of you.)
The above items will keep physical contact with each other to a minimum and within the parameters of Idahos Stay-Home Order, especially ensuring no one enters the school building, unless approved to do so.
Please know, too, that during this first week back we will carefully sterilize the school and pack up your students desk, placing their personal items in individual bags, along with other items they will need for week two and beyond. (School employees will wear masks and gloves to do this work.) Beginning Monday, April 20, from 8 a.m. to Noon, parents may pick up their students bag by driving up to the front of the school with an employee runner then retrieving your students bag from the school building and bringing it to your car.
Thank you for understanding the need to follow these strict guidelines of no entry into the school during this unprecedented time. Our purpose in doing so is to ensure everyones health and safety while also ensuring our school is clean, safe, and ready to go for when (hopefully) the Stay-Home Order is lifted.
There is nothing my teachers and I want more than to be in the classrooms with your students. It has been especially hard for us to accept that this wont be the case come tomorrow. However, if we are diligent in following the items above, adhering to the States Stay-Home Order, and doing our best to provide your students with a positive, distance-learning experience we hope well be together again sooner rather than later.
Thank you, and please keep watching your emails for continued communications.
Stay safe and well,
Mrs. Rebecca Stallcop
Administrator
Liberty Charter School District #458
**************************************************************
12 de abril de 2020
Hola padres de nuestros alumnos de K-8
Al comenzar esta primera semana en nuestro formato de aprendizaje a distancia, hay algunos elementos en los que debemos estar atentos para garantizar la salud y la seguridad de nuestra comunidad escolar:
n Si el maestro de su hijo se ha comunicado con usted que tendr paquetes de aprendizaje para que recoja en la escuela, tenga en cuenta que los paquetes se le distribuirn fuera del edificio escolar con la ayuda de un ayudante escolar. Por lo tanto, no ingresar al edificio de la escuela para recibir el paquete de su hijo.
n Lo mismo ocurrir al recoger a los estudiantes y hermanos, desayuno y almuerzo combinados, comidas para llevar con usted. El horario de recogida para las comidas es de 10:30 a.m. a medioda, de lunes a viernes. Por favor, qudese en su automvil (y asegrese de que los nios con usted permanezcan tambin en su automvil). Cuando sea recibido por un empleado o director de la escuela, hgales saber la cantidad de comidas que necesita para su (s) estudiante (s) y hermanos (as), de 1 a 18 aos, y l o ella los recuperar por usted. (Puede haber una lnea, as que por favor sea paciente con el empleado de la escuela mientras trabaja para cuidar de todos y cada uno de ustedes).
Los elementos anteriores mantendrn el contacto fsico entre ellos al mnimo y dentro de los parmetros de la Orden de permanencia en el hogar de Idaho, especialmente asegurando que nadie ingrese al edificio de la escuela, a menos que est aprobado para hacerlo.
Tenga en cuenta tambin que durante la primera semana de regreso esterilizaremos cuidadosamente la escuela y empacaremos el escritorio de su estudiante, colocando sus artculos personales en bolsas individuales, junto con otros artculos que necesitarn para la segunda semana y ms. (Los empleados de la escuela usarn mscaras y guantes para hacer este trabajo). A partir del lunes 20 de abril, de 8 am a medioda, los padres pueden recoger la bolsa de su estudiante conduciendo hasta el frente de la escuela con un corredor empleado y luego recogiendo el de su estudiante. bolsa del edificio de la escuela y llevarla a su automvil.
Gracias por entender la necesidad de seguir estas estrictas pautas de no ingresar a la escuela durante este tiempo sin precedentes. Nuestro propsito al hacerlo es garantizar la salud y la seguridad de todos y, al mismo tiempo, garantizar que nuestra escuela est limpia, segura y lista para cuando (con suerte) se levante la Orden de quedarse en casa.
Mis profesores y yo no queremos nada ms que estar en las aulas con sus alumnos. Ha sido especialmente difcil para nosotros aceptar que este no ser el caso maana. Sin embargo, si somos diligentes en seguir los puntos anteriores, cumplir con la Orden Estatal de Residencia y hacer todo lo posible para brindarles a sus estudiantes una experiencia positiva de aprendizaje a distancia, esperamos volver a estar juntos ms pronto que tarde.
Gracias, y siga vigilando sus correos electrnicos para comunicaciones continuas.
Mantente seguro y bien
Sra. Rebecca Stallcop
Administrador
Liberty Charter School District # 458
April 8, 2020
Here is a link for a Schoology Tutorial that will assist both Parents and Students.
Schoology Tutorial
Please be aware that this was created for Victory Charter School and the site name will not be the same but the basic information will apply.
April 6, 2020
Hello Parents of High Schoolers
Here's a housekeeping item regarding high school student lockers:
This Wednesday, Thursday, and Friday (April 8-10) from 8am to noon, the school will be open for high school students only to come by and collect needed items from their lockers. There will be hand sanitizer at the front desk that students must use before they head back to the high school side of the building. Students must wear something to cover their nose and mouth (for instance, scarf or handkerchief) for when they enter the building. They will go directly to their locker (using social distancing), gather the items they need, and then leave. Some high school teachers may have additional supplies for their students to pick up. They will let their students know through Schoology.
Parents, you and your students have been amazing. Thank you for being flexible with us as we prepare for a new normal for the time being in our educating your students. Well keep you and your students updated via email, Schoology, and on the school website under the COVID-19 tab, so be sure to keep checking these communication avenues.
Thank you, and please continue to take care of yourselves and those around you.
Mrs. Rebecca Stallcop
Administrator
Liberty Charter School District #458
**************************************************************************
6 de abril de 2020
Hola padres de estudiantes de secundaria -
Aqu hay un artculo de limpieza sobre los casilleros de estudiantes de secundaria:
Este mircoles, jueves y viernes (8-10 de abril) de 8 am a medioda, la escuela estar abierta para que los estudiantes de secundaria solo vengan y recojan los artculos necesarios de sus casilleros. Habr desinfectante de manos en la recepcin que los estudiantes deben usar antes de regresar al lado de la escuela secundaria del edificio. Los estudiantes deben usar algo para cubrirse la nariz y la boca (por ejemplo, bufanda o pauelo) para cuando entren al edificio. Irn directamente a su casillero (usando distanciamiento social), reunirn los artculos que necesitan y luego se irn. Algunos maestros de escuela secundaria pueden tener tiles adicionales para que sus alumnos los recojan. Informarn a sus alumnos a travs de Schoology.
Padres, ustedes y sus alumnos han sido increbles. Gracias por ser flexible con nosotros mientras nos preparamos para "una nueva normalidad" por el momento en nuestra educacin de sus estudiantes. Los mantendremos informados a usted y a sus estudiantes por correo electrnico, Schoology y en el sitio web de la escuela en la pestaa COVID-19, as que asegrese de seguir revisando estas vas de comunicacin.
Gracias, y por favor continen cuidando a ustedes mismos y a los que los rodean.
Sra. Rebecca Stallcop
Administrador
Liberty Charter School District # 458
April 6, 2020
Dear K-8 Parents Hopefully, you all have had a chance to review the letter sent last Wednesday (below), but just to be safe, were sending it again with a reminder to be on the look-out for an email from childs teacher this Wednesday, April 8.
Thank you.
******************************************************************************
March 31, 2020
Hello Parents of our Kindergarten through 8th Grade Students,
While we dont want to inundate you with communications during spring break, we do want to keep you informed as we know COVID-19 is presenting all of us with challenges we need to plan for sooner rather than later. This note is to provide an update on where were heading in educating your students come Monday, April 13.
As we shared in the March 25 parent letter, we will employ distance learning beginning April 13. We are anticipating that distance learning will continue until the end of April. Thank you, again, for responding so quickly with information regarding your home wifi connectivity and availability of devices.
First, to hopefully help put your minds at ease, students will not be required to spend countless hours a day on a device, and their lessons will not be live. In other words, your family should not need multiple devices in the home in order for your students to attend school. As a result, we will not need to provide a device for each student. However, for those who have shared that they have no devices at home, one will be provided. Our teachers are working incredibly hard preparing video lessons that can be watched at a times that work well for your family and takes into account more than one student in the home, and breaks them up in such a way that no student is sitting through lengthy lessons. Much like their regular classroom, your students at-home learning will be broken up into short, learning chunks.
All total, K-8 students will have no more than 1-hour of videos to view per day. The videos will be coupled with assignments and homework that can be completed either on a device, or off it. For those who have shared with us that they have no wifi connectivity, you will be contacted (if you havent already) to arrange an alternative educational approach. Some grades might have take-home packets with lessons and activities. If take-home packets are used, please know extra precautions in preparing them will be in place, including gloves being used to assemble the packets and separation of the packets for at least 48 hours when they are returned, among other safety measures.
Generally, for grades K-8, a distance learning day will look like this: Video lessons for math, language, reading, and science (videos for math lessons will be posted Monday-Thursday; language, reading and science videos will be posted one day per week); assignments/homework similar to what they already do; a weekly assessment in math on Friday; and optional, additional learning activities for those families interested. The beautiful thing about posting videos, rather than hosting live learning sessions, is your students can watch their videos and review them as theyd like, or as needed. This approach takes our philosophy of, If you dont get it today, youll get it tomorrow; if not tomorrow, then the next day, and so on and puts it into play in this distance learning format. We know youll be surprised, if not amazed, watching your childs ability to continue to learn in the manner to which theyre accustomed (direct instruction/choral response), even in this video format. In fact, please encourage them to respond as they would if they were in class with their peers. We have no doubt you will be impressed at the pace of each lesson and the way in which your students respond. We hope it will provide you with what many parents say to us so often: that they wish they had a front-row seat to their childs school day. Come April 13, you will be involved in way that perhaps you havent before by attending the videos with your children and being right there to encourage them as they work through a lesson.
Important things to know:
n One of the most important things we want you to know is you will not have to present the lessons yourselves, or know the content before your children view their videos or work on their assignments/homework. In fact, in the videos teachers will use the Think Aloud method whereby they will think out loud the concept being taught from start to finish so that their students can follow along with them as they work it through to completion. The teachers are going to great lengths to plan and present an at-home learning experience that is as close to their students regular school day, but also manageable for a family.
n Technology will be less than perfect. We understand and know that there will be technology glitches. Your home connectivity might be fine one day and struggle the next. The learning platform well be using might be slow one day, no response on another day, and fine the next. Please know we will work with you on technology issues. The numbers of school districts globally now forced to use an online form of education is staggering, so all schools and students will have issues at some point.
n On April 8, you will receive an email from your childs teacher (if you have multiple students attending our school, you will receive an email from each of your childrens teachers), sharing their expectations for their students, and detailing their educational plans for their class while providing you with your students log-in information into Schoology, the learning platform to be used. While a fairly straight-forward, simple platform, the teachers will include in their letters a link to an online tutorial for you to view to familiarize yourselves with Schoology, if youre not already. Additionally, teachers will share the process for contacting them if you or your student is experiencing technical issues, how attendance will be taken, what will be graded, how to turn in homework and assignments, their teacher contact hours should you need to reach them, and how they will contact you if/when necessary.
n Our school district has been approved as a site for picking up free meals beginning April 13. Free, cold breakfast and lunch combo meals for students and their siblings, ages 1-18, will be available daily for curbside pickup at the school between 10:30 am Noon while supplies last. The meals are to be taken and not consumed on site.
n The first day back to school, but in this distance learning format, is Monday, April 13.
We continue to thank you for your support and willingness, using a phrase that works well with Harbor, to venture through these unchartered waters with us. As a Harbor school, your students have already been learning and achieving at an incredible pace in an educational environment that provides above-grade learning in a safe and kind culture. We know their learning will continue and that they will do their best to adapt to this temporary school format.
We cant wait to be back with your students in the school building. Until then, thank you for partnering with us to help ensure that they continue to excel. We will, in the days and weeks ahead, do our best to be our very best for your students, and well address issues that might come up with flexibility and positivity so we can model to them how to face tough situations well.
Above everything, please take care of yourselves, your children, and all those around you. We look forward to hearing your students stories of success once were back together.
All our best to you and your students,
Mrs. Rebecca Stallcop
Administrator
Liberty Charter School District #458
April 1, 2020
Parents, please see attached documents for information on preparing for distance learning.
Thanks.
Preparing For Distance Learning - English
Preparing For Distance Learning - Spanish
April 1, 2020
Breakfast & Lunch Meals Update April 1, 2020
Beginning Monday, April 13, the free, cold breakfast and lunch combo meals for students and their siblings, ages 1-18, will be available daily for curbside pickup at the school between 10:30 am Noon while supplies last. UPDATE: Students and siblings do NOT now need to be present to receive the meals. Please remember the meals are to be taken and not consumed on site. Thank you.
Actualizacin de desayuno y almuerzo - 1 de abril de 2020
A partir del lunes 13 de abril, las comidas combinadas gratuitas para el desayuno y el almuerzo fros para los estudiantes y sus hermanos, de 1 a 18 aos, estarn disponibles todos los das para que los recojan en la acera en la escuela entre las 10:30 a.m. y el medioda hasta agotar existencias. ACTUALIZACIN: Los estudiantes y hermanos NO necesitan estar presentes para recibir las comidas. Recuerde que las comidas deben tomarse y no consumirse en el sitio. Gracias.
March 25, 2020
Parents Thank you for your quick replies to the email yesterday, March 24, regarding your home WIFI access. Were receiving good information from you that is greatly helping us put in place what we now know will be the need to use remote learning our first week back from spring break, April 13-17.
More details will be coming regarding the approaches well use April 13-17 so you and your students can prepare. If youve yet to reply to yesterdays email, please do so as soon as possible, letting us know if you do not haveWIFI access, and if you will have challenges in providing devices (i.e., PCs, laptops, etc.) for your students to use at home.Although, we have access to limited devices, we will try our best to provide those with no devices. Once this information is collected we will be able to determine the bestarrangements for offering school attendance options to ensure our students are learning in the most effective ways possible.
Also, for April 13-17, free, cold-lunch combomealsfor students and their siblings, ages 1-18, will be available daily for curbside pickup at the school between 10:30 am Noon while supplies last. The meals are to be taken and not consumed on site. Children must be present to receive a free meal.
If you know of parents who might not be receiving these emails for some reason, please let us know, so we can contact them another way, or please ask them to call the school office. We want to make sure everyone is receiving these updates. The way in which our school community is coming together has been incredible and we appreciate all our efforts in helping each other. Thank you for your ongoing support.
We will keep updating you as we approach April 13, and we will be working with families individually as necessary to ensure all our students have access to their education that week. Please keep checking your email inbox, the school website and Facebook for information.
We continue to stay positive in our hopes you all are well and that tomorrow, the first day of spring break, is one you can enjoy among the uncertainties.
Mrs. Rebecca Stallcop
Administrator
Liberty Charter School
******************************************************
25 de marzo de 2020
Padres: gracias por sus rpidas respuestas al correo electrnico de ayer, 24 de marzo, con respecto al acceso WIFI de su hogar. Recibimos buena informacin suya que nos ayuda en gran medida a poner en prctica lo que ahora sabemos ser la necesidad de utilizar el aprendizaje remoto nuestra primera semana de regreso del receso de primavera, del 13 al 17 de abril.
Llegarn ms detalles sobre los enfoques que usaremos del 13 al 17 de abril para que usted y sus alumnos puedan prepararse. Si an no ha respondido al correo electrnico de ayer, hgalo lo antes posible, infrmenos si no tiene acceso a WIFI y si tendr problemas para proporcionar dispositivos (es decir, PC, computadoras porttiles, etc.) para sus alumnos para usar en casa. Aunque, tenemos acceso a dispositivos limitados, haremos todo lo posible para proporcionar a los que no tienen dispositivos. Una vez que se recopile esta informacin, podremos determinar los mejores arreglos para ofrecer opciones de asistencia a la escuela para asegurar que nuestros estudiantes estn aprendiendo de la manera ms efectiva posible.
Adems, del 13 al 17 de abril, habr comidas combinadas gratuitas de almuerzo fro para estudiantes y sus hermanos, de 1 a 18 aos, disponibles diariamente para que los recojan en la escuela en la escuela entre las 10:30 a.m. y el medioda hasta agotar existencias. Las comidas deben tomarse y no consumirse en el sitio. Los nios deben estar presentes para recibir una comida gratis.
Si conoce a los padres que podran no estar recibiendo estos correos electrnicos por alguna razn, hganoslo saber para que podamos contactarlos de otra manera, o pdales que llamen a la oficina de la escuela. Queremos asegurarnos de que todos reciban estas actualizaciones. La forma en que nuestra comunidad escolar se ha unido ha sido increble y apreciamos todos nuestros esfuerzos para ayudarnos mutuamente. Gracias por su continua ayuda.
Seguiremos actualizando a medida que nos acercamos al 13 de abril, y trabajaremos con las familias individualmente segn sea necesario para asegurar que todos nuestros estudiantes tengan acceso a su educacin esa semana. Siga revisando su bandeja de entrada de correo electrnico, el sitio web de la escuela y Facebook para obtener informacin.
Seguimos siendo positivos con la esperanza de que todos estn bien y que maana, el primer da de las vacaciones de primavera, sea uno de los que pueda disfrutar entre las incertidumbres.
Sra. Rebecca Stallcop
Administrador
Liberty Charter School # 458
Parent Letter 3-24-2020
Hello Liberty Parents we wanted to touch base with you before we technically begin our scheduled spring break, which runs from March 26-April 10.
As we continue to work to stay ahead of the COVID-19 curve while following the directives by health officials, our Governor, and the State Board of Education, we are committed to maintaining our high standards of education and safety for your students. Realizing this might require an online component, depending on where things stand in a couple of weeks, we want to be as prepared as possible.
Therefore, we need your assistance by providing the following information to us as soon as possible:
If you donothave WIFI access at home, please reply tooffice@libertycharterschool.comsaying so, making sure to include the names and grades of your students attending our school. While our teachers have a pretty good idea of which families might be without WIFI service, we want to do our best to confirm the information. Thank you for your quick replies.
We will remain in contact with you over spring break, so please be sure to check email often, as well as the schools website and social media.
Take care and stay well,
Mrs. Rebecca Stallcop
Administrator
Online Instruction Info for High School Students and Parents 3-17-2020
High School Parents,
included below is what your student(s) have been instructed to do from their teachers for online instruction. If your student has problems getting into Schoology please email theirteacheror the high school office athsoffice@libertycharterschool.comTheir usernames are the same as their PowerSchool ids and passwords are lcs2020 unless they have changed them.
High School Students,
You must log in to Schoology and work on something for each class each day and complete assignments as instructed by 5 p.m. This is how you are getting credit and attendance. You must email teachers if you need help with a class code.
It is imperative that we do this to avoid make-up days.
Contact teachers or leave a message with your high school if the need arises.
Stay well!
Coronavirus Parent Letter - Shut down 3-16-2020
March 16, 2020
Liberty Charter closed March 17-April 10 for K-8; high school students to attend classes online March 17-25.
To continue our efforts in being overly cautious while best serving our students, staff and families, the school will be closed beginning tomorrow, March 17, for its K-8 students and will remain closed through Friday, April 10.
For our high school students (9th-12th grade), they will attend classes online March 17-25, with spring break beginning March 26 through April 10. This means their classes will be online this Tuesday-Friday (March 17-20), and next Monday-Wednesday (March 23-25). High school teachers worked with their students today to help prepare them for this change. High school teachers will be available to their students the remainder of this week and next Monday-Wednesday via Schoology and email each school day. The high school teachers are providing an educational alternative for those students who do not have access to online learning from home.
All athletics and activities, including practices, have been suspended until at least April 6.
Limited staff will be at the school March 17-20 and March 23-25 for parents and students to pick up personal belongings, etc.
While the school is closed, please continue practicing social distancing, practicing sound personal hygiene and following the latest guidance from the CDC and Southwest District Health.
Thank you and continue to take care. See you all back on April 13.
Mrs. Rebecca Stallcop
Administrator
Liberty Charter School #458
Liberty Charter cerr del 17 de marzo al 10 de abril para K-8; estudiantes de secundaria asistirn a clases en lnea del 17 al 25 de marzo.
Para continuar nuestros esfuerzos de ser excesivamente cautelosos mientras servimos mejor a nuestros estudiantes, personal y familias, la escuela estar cerrada a partir de maana, 17 de marzo, para sus estudiantes de K-8 y permanecer cerrada hasta el viernes 10 de abril.
Para nuestros estudiantes de secundaria (9 a 12 grado), asistirn a clases en lnea del 17 al 25 de marzo, y las vacaciones de primavera comenzarn del 26 de marzo al 10 de abril. Esto significa que sus clases estarn en lnea de martes a viernes (del 17 al 20 de marzo), y el prximo lunes-mircoles (23-25 de marzo). Los maestros de secundaria trabajaron con sus estudiantes hoy para ayudarlos a prepararse para este cambio. Los maestros de la escuela secundaria estarn disponibles para sus estudiantes el resto de esta semana y el prximo lunes a mircoles a travs de Schoology y por correo electrnico cada da escolar. Los profesores de secundaria ofrecen una alternativa educativa para aquellos estudiantes que no tienen acceso al aprendizaje en lnea desde su hogar.
Todos los deportes y actividades, incluidas las prcticas, se han suspendido hasta al menos el 6 de abril.
El personal limitado estar en la escuela del 17 al 20 de marzo y del 23 al 25 de marzo para que padres y estudiantes recojan sus pertenencias personales, etc.
Mientras la escuela est cerrada, contine practicando el distanciamiento social, practicando una higiene personal slida y siguiendo las ltimas pautas de los CDC y Southwest District Health.
Coronavirus Parents Letter - Shut down
Coronavirus Parents Letter - Shut down Spanish
March 13, 2020
SPRING PARENT-TEACHER CONFERENCES CANCELLED
Parents Due to continuing concerns regarding Corornavirus/COVID-19 and our efforts toprevent the introduction and spread of the virus in our school and among our families, spring parent-teacher conferences have beencancelled. If you have concerns regarding your student and would like to meet with her/his teacher(s) before the end of the school year, please contact the teacher to arrange a time to meet. Likewise, if there are students in which teachers are concerned, their parents will be contacted by the teacher. Thank you for your understanding and care as we continue to keep our school community safe and healthy.
